website_summaries.verdict: High-quality reel aimed at catching large game fish. Great reel for saltwater fishing.
pros: Drag is both powerful and smooth
Very good gear ratio of 6.2 to 1
Design prevents any slippage in the line
cons: Potentially some binding in line after several uses
Clunky feel when trying to cast long distances

customer_reviews.title: Effective but not durable
customer_reviews.text: My primary use for this reel was surfcasting in New Jersey for inshore species, like bluefish and striped bass. I used it regularly for one season and it served me well: the drag was smooth and I landed many fish with it. I cleaned and maintained the reel as per the manufacturer's recommendations. Unfortunately, after one season the main gear failed a few months following the expiry of the warranty. This reel may suit your needs if you fish occasionally, but due to my experience I would not recommend this reel for regular use.
customer_reviews.author: R.J. George

customer_reviews.title: Too bad so sad
customer_reviews.text: bought this reel 2 times thinking it was just coincidence that the first one got sticky on cranking in fish brand new outta box...Had it serviced and in the mean time ordered another..Too bad so sad, got hosed again and the same problem occurred. Penn quality has never been so low. no more Penns for me
customer_reviews.author: hawaiian angler

customer_reviews.title: Penn Battle II 3000
customer_reviews.text: This reel is everything I wanted and more. It retrieval is flawless and it has held up to a 5+ ft shark that hooked my line. I love the braid ready strip which has held my spiderwire stealth 30lb braided line well. I went to a live bait shop at Myrtle beach and this reel on the ugly stick is what the owner had in the store for sale and what the owner stated he uses on his charters. I have the 3000 and it is the perfect combo reel. I use this for mainly freshwater and trips to the beach. I highly recommend this reel.
customer_reviews.author: rizzaman12

customer_reviews.title: Too much heavy grease, reels stiff!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd newer Penn reel that I purchased over the last couple years. The other is a Spinfisher 3k. Like my Spinfisher the gear housing is packed with so much thick blue grease the reel reels stiffly, like there is resistance on it. This makes the reels unusable in my opinion. My older Penn reels are smooth and easy to reel, my Shims on reels are smooth and easy to reel. I am not sure what Penn is doing but unless they address this issue this will be the last Penn spinning reel I will buy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Penn was good to me before I bought this
customer_reviews.text: The first time I actually got to use it I casted it with the head of a bonita and I heard a weird noise I normally don't hear while fishing, Its broken... I called the local bait shacks near by and most said 70 to 80 dollar repair for a small fix. They told me just go buy a new one. Screw the penn battle series. I recommend to go buy a fin-nor lethal, they are cheaper, stronger, and built better in my experience with penn. Unbelievable
customer_reviews.author: M. Nolfi

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Locked up on the very first use. Its been more than 30 days so i cant return it.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Incredible quality and value. You simply can’t buy a better reel for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The reel is so tight, winds perfectly, and cast farther than any spinning reel I own. It sounds corny but it’s a real pleasure to fish with and the drag is amazingly smooth. No question in my mind, and I research EVERY purchase to death, (drives my wife and friends nuts but they’re always impressed by the outcome), this IS the best most durable reel in this price range you will find ANYWHERE, and AMAZON has the best price and support you’ll find. Fast delivery, incredible quality and at an amazing price.
customer_reviews.author: D.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I have used this reel for 2 years. I am not gentle with this reel. I have not rinsed her faithfully with fresh water. I have been ruthlessly demanding of this reel. I have caught hundreds of hungry striped bass in shallow water, on top water lures, with swim shads, buck tails and jig heads with soft plastics, bottom fishing with fresh bait and jigging with lures in deeper water. This reel is very forgiving..........
customer_reviews.author: harmonicabob

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY THE “used”
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the “used” version because it said there was only cosmetic issues . Which who cares they get beat up anyway , especially if your saving around $20-30 bucks . When the reel came is it was spooled with old mono that had salt caked onto the line itself . Then to top it off , the insert that is on the handle that screws into the reel itself had salt Corrosion all over it . Then the cherry on the top ; no matter how hard you tried to reel as soon as you stopped the reel would seize up because the reel was in such bad shape ! Awesome reel BUT DONT TRUST THAT COMPANY SELLING THE “used”
customer_reviews.author: David P.

customer_reviews.title: Solid spinning reels
customer_reviews.text: I own a few of these and you won't find a better value in a spinning reel for this price point. This reel delivers the most bang for your buck for serious use in all saltwater fishing applications
customer_reviews.author: Fernando G

customer_reviews.title: This is a great reel. I would buy it all over again ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reel. I would buy it all over again but the fishing I bought it for is for fresh water fishing in the Rio Paraguay/Pantanal region of Brazil using 50 Lb test. If I had to purchase this over again I would consider the next size down. It is a little bulky but it holds plenty of line. I have caught plenty of fish on this reel and there is nothing wrong with it and it appears to be the highest quality. This includes two different fishing trips to the Pantanal.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: About As Good As It Gets for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace a Daiwa that is getting harder and harder to crank after being used in one of the harshest environments for reels I've ever fished in. The Battle II has held up far better and longer, and the sealed bearings make a big difference. I think I've caught close to 50 fish with it already, and the drag has always been smooth. Great for fluorocarbon line!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Croom

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: I am a charter captain in Tampa bay. I use the Penn Battle II 4000 on every rod I have wish 30lb power pro braid. I have yet to have a problem with any of the 6 reels (except 1 that was dropped in the water). After countless fish caught, abuse from careless customers and almost daily usage I can say these reels are worth every penny. Just clean and lube them on a regular basis and they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: sean s.

customer_reviews.title: Have several, love them, will continue buying these awesome reels
customer_reviews.text: Have several of these and use them for shore fishing on the ocean. As long as you religiously clean them after each use and grease/oil them, they’ll last. I’ve had them for several years with not a single issue and they are smoother than any reel I’ve ever had. I’m sure there’s more expensive reels that may be better, but for the money and then some, these are hands down the best reels out there.
customer_reviews.author: Mit

customer_reviews.title: Reel broke first trip
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple weeks ago and i am currently in a fishing trip in the Gulf. Half way through my third day reel seized up as i was reeling in a whiting and as i tried to crank a little harder gears started grinding. Now stuck without a reel for the rest of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Solid design, high end feel and operation
customer_reviews.text: Ive had the original Penn Battle 5K for about 5 years and while its still going strong, I decided to try the new Battle II paired with a new surf fiahing rod. Really nice. The improvements over the original are noticable (full metal body). Bail seems much beefier and bearings seem a lot smoother. Bought another one to match to my other surf rod and this is what I take to the beach now. Really pleased with the battle 2, and for the price, you can't beat em'
customer_reviews.author: KwidLi

customer_reviews.title: At Last
customer_reviews.text: I just retired and want to re-take up fishing. All my rods and reels were cheapies from when I had no time to do it right. After retiring, I took all the old reels apart, inspected, cleaned, and greased them all. Still...they were, how do I say this, ...weak. Got this reel yesterday, haven't fished with it yet, but even just trying it "dry," it's a vast, vast improvement over the Wallie World reels I've used in the past. Mostly, I feel I can trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great all around performance!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reel for my surf fishing setup and it has been fantastic. Havent had any issues with it so far. The reel feels and functions as a premium device but I managed to get mine on a sale so it did not have a premium price tag. I would highly recommend this reel for most saltwater surf/dock fishing! I will update months down the road.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great reel
customer_reviews.text: For the money I love this reel. I have been using the same model on one of my surf rods for a few years now. Its smooth, lightweight, and great with mono and braid. I got this one to replace a reel that crapped out on me. Keep them clean, out of he sand, and wash off with clean tap water after a day fishing and they will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: It is no good for surf fishing.
customer_reviews.text: Not water resistance. I bought it according Peen's reputation. After one time Trout fishing, the reel began to stuck. It was not soaked in salt water. So I returned it. Very disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: xsxu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reel, used it in the surf and is ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome reel, used it in the surf and is an easy clean up, enough drag to do whatever you need it for. Not super heavy but made with quality metals.
customer_reviews.author: texican

customer_reviews.title: Great reel
customer_reviews.text: My wide and I have one of these each. We use them for Salmon and steelhead fishing. They preform well. They are very responsive and feel like they can take a beating. They are slightly heavy, but not a concern because we bought a large reel for a reason. The weight is a non issue. I would buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Bern

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and smooth reel with reasonable price. Fast shipping. Here is my update for this Penn Battle II - 5000 reel. Very well built. Using it for last few months. Lucky to catch about 7 cow nose ray in one day. No problem to land them all. Here is the largest one. Estimate over 70 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: One fine salmon reel.
customer_reviews.text: Powerful salmon reel. I bought this to catch Kenai salmon. It does this with great ease. I use braid. The reel holds > 300 yards of 50lb. The cast is as nice as any spin caster I’ve used. The drag adjusts precisely, in well defined clicks, and hold. The retrieval is smooth, precise and powerful. Fighting a salmon becomes fun, not a chore. I would like Penn to add a means of reversing the bail for those times when I’ve jammed the weight against the top ferrule and have the bail not in position to trip. Overall, this is one fine fishing reel.
customer_reviews.author: DocHolliday

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel
customer_reviews.text: Makes me feel like one of those TV fishermen when I show up with my $100 reel. It does work nice, heavy weight feels like it will last a long time. I have two young kids so my setup lays in the dirt most of the time anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the money. I got the 3000 and it's smooth and reliable. I've had it for a year or so and paid $50 for it here on Amazon. They have rizen the price a lot but it's still a good value even at $70. This is the lowest-end real I'd buy but having said that, if this was my only real I'd be perfectly happy. Far superior to those $30-40 plastic reals.
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: A good solid reel
customer_reviews.text: I love the Battle II series of reels. They balance extremely well on a rod, and are very smooth, with superb drag system. And, they're affordable.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Buttery smooth
customer_reviews.text: Love this fishing reel. Feels smooth and casts a mile. Very easy to disassemble and clean. Used it over a hundred times at least and still feels as smooth as the day I bought it. Very much worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: It's a Penn
customer_reviews.text: It's a Penn so the quality is there. I really like the 2500 for speckled trout fishing. I throw jig bait with 10 lb mono. I like the 2500 for this better then the 2000. Glad they added this size to the line up
customer_reviews.author: Desi-man

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel
customer_reviews.text: I bought this reel because of the so many positive reviews. It's a good reel. Used it in salt water and it performed well. I washed it after every use and when I went back to use it after a few months without use it was jam. I disassembled it, oil it, and it came back to life. I give it 4 stars because I have lots of Shimano reels and never had a problem like that with non of them. And because of the weight, in my opinion it is too heavy.
customer_reviews.author: NegroL

customer_reviews.title: Penn Battle II 1000
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a quality lighter reel for trout stream fishing. I rigged it up with 4 lb on a Fenwick 5’ 3” HMX rod. Absolutely awesome combo. I’d recommend this particular reel to anyone who wants a lighter durable setup. If anyone decided to go with the reel rod combo I mentioned it is extremely sensitive. The only downfall is if you’re fishing in creeks and streams that are a little more rocky it’s tough because sometimes you’ll get in spots where everything can feel like a bite. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Pete Vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price, but if you want weather proof you’ll have to go up a notch to the Clash.
customer_reviews.text: I like it but my only complaint is it cant handle adverse weather very well. Started to make noises after it was eposed to rain. You’d think it would be sealed well enough to handle rain. Still, a very good reel and will be buying another one (with the awareness that Ill have to keep up on the oil).
customer_reviews.author: Jason Supertramp

customer_reviews.title: Nice reel!
customer_reviews.text: So far liking this reel. Only used it once but very smooth operating reel, and being the 5000 a bit more power. Nice having the 25lbs of max drag on it. Can angle at some bigger fish and handle with no problem. Im looking at getting a battle II 6000 next.
customer_reviews.author: DZ

customer_reviews.title: Mercedes of Reels
customer_reviews.text: These reels are like a Mercedes Benz, if you drive one it will be the only vehicle you want. Fishing with Peen reels are the same way, once you use one, it will be the one you will buy.
customer_reviews.author: James Smith

customer_reviews.title: If you like overbuilt, solid and dependable... go PENN
customer_reviews.text: Great value, seems almost overbuilt with its weight, but that’s a good thing in my opinion. I use the 3000 with a 6.5 medium action for wade fishing. It handled a nice 20.5” trout as it’s first official bite and retrieved beautiful. Highly recommend for saltwater use.
customer_reviews.author: Berenice A. Carstetter

customer_reviews.title: Great Spinning Reel
customer_reviews.text: I have other Penn spinning reels so when I ordered this one I already knew it would be awesome. ....and it is ! Very smooth long range casting. Just perfect for bigger game pier fishing and surf fishing . Penn reels are very dependable. Just love it !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I keep coming back to them because the price-point is excellent and they just simply hold up extremely well
customer_reviews.text: For the past several years, I have a bought one new Penn Battle II reel and cycled the older reels into the backup pile. I keep coming back to them because the price-point is excellent and they just simply hold up extremely well. We're not using them for technical fishing or on a charter boat, so they fit the bill perfectly for our needs. The drag and action remain smooth year after year with virtually no maintenance. We use them on for inshore saltwater fishing exclusively. I expect to buy another one next year, and another and another...
customer_reviews.author: Florida Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Overall not bad.
customer_reviews.text: It feels sturdy overall but compared to its competitor (Daiwa BG) I believe the overall construction is lacking. I only used this for a couple of weeks and the BG for 2 years. So I can only comment on limited features. But I would say Penn Battle II is more suited for smaller reel sizes 3000 and below.
customer_reviews.author: ayTop Contributor: Fishing

customer_reviews.title: Penn Battle II
customer_reviews.text: I've owned one of these for over a year now and have been using it consistently. The reels action is very smooth and quiet, Paired with a Shimano Teramar rod and braided line, you can sense anything on the end of that line. The performance has been outstanding compared to other reels I've used in the past. I just ordered a second one for myself, and another for a family member. For this price, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Lembcrickas

customer_reviews.title: Very smooth and a great size
customer_reviews.text: I really like the size of the reel. Very smooth and a nice steady drag. Although I can't say the same about Penn's Customer Service. I had an issue with the line lay(which they supply washers to adjust). After swapping the washer to get the line to lay correctly the drag has become almost inaudible. And to this point I have gotten very little to no help from writing Penn. While the reel still works fine and maybe it's just mental; it doesn't feel perfect.
customer_reviews.author: BullNY

customer_reviews.title: What I expect from Penn!
customer_reviews.text: Spent about a week in Matagorda, TX fishing with this reel. Great quality, smooth, and fit and finish is too notch. Will continue to purchase Penn reels.
customer_reviews.author: Motherofdragonz

customer_reviews.title: Great reel for casting, recommended, just make sure all parts are in the box
customer_reviews.text: This is a great reel , really smooth. The only issue I had is that probably in the transportation the nob that covers the whole at one side of the reel got lost. I am looking into the spare part now which is difficult to find. Hope Penn send a new Reel without this problem. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: This reel is a must! High quality!
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for a reel that can go anywhere this is the one. I got this since april and it runs super smooth, ive been going out to fish 2-3 times a week since I got it and it still runs as smooth as when I first got it. It's super silent when you cast your line. It feels good on rods medium and up. Great job pen.
customer_reviews.author: Hanna JBauer

customer_reviews.title: Super smooth reel
customer_reviews.text: Spooled it with 6lb test and caught this baby on the 5th cast. This reel i sooo smooth. I got two other ultralight reels this week and returned them both - one was a Lew’s and the other was some Yinhai. Each had some flaw out of the box and was on the cheap side. The Penns are always smooth and durable. With fishing reels you really get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: BerryB

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for a good reel
customer_reviews.text: This is probably the worst spinning reel I own. It inevitably binds up on the retrieve. I’ve opened it and cleaned it and oiled it and greased it and it seems to wind smoothly until I use it again. Same story every 1-2 outings. I’m not sure if it has a defect or not but this is a piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: C. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great reel.
customer_reviews.text: My first nice spinning reel. I couldn't ask for a better reel. I've used more expensive ones but this is the best for the money, and among the best period, that I've ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Sockwell

customer_reviews.title: Good reel for the price
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased the penn battle 2 6000 series. It's a little heavier than the BG 4500 which is comparable in size but much beefier ( bail is thicker). I've caught some big saltwater fish with this reel. The drag is smooth and has some real stopping power. If you want a reel for around the $80.00 mark, I would recommend that you give this reel a try. Chad
customer_reviews.author: Chad Takakura

customer_reviews.title: But it is fine just thought this idea may continue from top sales ...
customer_reviews.text: I am always impressed by the quality of the Penn systems, gave it a 4 by virtue of getting only one spool. in the past when I have bought top line rigs they always had a second spool as a replacement or to load up additional line. But it is fine just thought this idea may continue from top sales orgs...
customer_reviews.author: skagman

customer_reviews.title: Good reels for lazy maintenance in salt!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my father because I got tired of home rusting away nice shimano reels inshore fishing! Not the reels fault lack of care! These reels have managed to stand up to neglect and minimal love they seldom even get a freshwater rinse but are holding up physically and mechanically after a year and a half...time will tell but great so far!
customer_reviews.author: Trikworm

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a reel
customer_reviews.text: I use this reel for trophy size catfish (8000 size) and she's a beast, has no problem horsing in 50-60 pound feisty flatheads. Construction feels nice and sturdy as hell. I also have its cheaper brother the penn pursuit 8000 and this reel beats it all day, just a bullet proof piece of gear
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: WOW, really good.....
customer_reviews.text: If you are a regular fisherman this seems to be very good quality. I use this reel once or twice a week, because of its quality build I fully expect it to stand the test of time.
customer_reviews.author: Bookie_Monster

customer_reviews.title: Great reel although fish still laugh at me
customer_reviews.text: I'm somewhere between a novice and mid-experience fisherman and this reel is great for my purposes. Mostly used for pond fishing with all different types of lures. It had great play and quick/easy tension setting on bass ranging between one and six pounds. Absolutely no complaints although I never knew that fish could laugh at me spending hours at the pond without a bite....not the reel's fault though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Put this reel on my 8' pole and went deep ...
customer_reviews.text: Put this reel on my 8' pole and went deep sea fishing at night. Performed flawlessly and very quiet. This is exactly what I needed for my 20 lb test line.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D.

customer_reviews.title: Penn = Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: I am relatively new to Penn reels...and I was very quickly Hooked on them! So for my new offshore rod I wanted something serious...and this reel is IT! It is pretty much perfect, right down to the handle because I have a crippled hand that can still handle the angle and size of the handle!
customer_reviews.author: Three Legged Lizard Custom Crafts

customer_reviews.title: I like my reels
customer_reviews.text: I use my TWO Penn Battles for inshore saltwater fishing in Florida. I use one for live bait and the other for jigging. After a lot of research I bought these and I am glad I did. I highly recommend them. And Amazon's price was right too....
customer_reviews.author: AMNSBFL

customer_reviews.title: Penn Battle II 1000
customer_reviews.text: I don't usually fish for carp, but look what happened along. Spooled this with six pound test and ten pound shock leader. Pretty good workout for a 8.1 ounce reel. I have this on a seventeen year old Falcon 5' Ultra Lite rod (Made in the USA!) This will be an excellent crappie rod.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: These are the best reels I have ever Purchased! I use them for fresh water fishing. The drag on these reels are top of the line. I will be buying more of these!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A couple times I've had wind knots
customer_reviews.text: A couple times I've had wind knots. Haven't had this issue with other reels. I've had it for a few months and feels like I need to lubricate for more smoothness.
customer_reviews.author: Sharol Yn

customer_reviews.title: Overslot Red
customer_reviews.text: When it arrived I thought I might need a bigger reel since I was targeting Reds inshore, but I caught a 29-1/2" Overslot Red and had to throw it back. The real held up just fine. This Penn reel outperformed my larger Penn 4400ss.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Review

customer_reviews.title: Love my Penns all of them you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Its a Penn nothing to dislike have had them reels for years.The newer they are the more advanced smoother lighter just more of everything kind of hard to like anything else you get what you pay for love my stuff ty penn.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Costa

customer_reviews.title: Love my Penn reels
customer_reviews.text: Just bought another Penn Battle this is my 4th one . I have Penn Fierce reels as well but this 4000 battle is hands down my favorite go to reel. I'm fishing salt and freshwater and these Penn reels perform flawlessly . I take these out with confidence knowing a good day of fishing without reel problems is what I'm getting . Can't go wrong on a Penn reel ....proud owner of 5 Penn fierce and 4 Penn Battle from the 2500 to the 8000 models.
customer_reviews.author: superglide2004

customer_reviews.title: Try it out!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this has a great beak, smooth drag and smooth Retrieving. I give it 3 stars because I have one annoying issue with mine(might just be mine)... when the spool is at the top position, the bail hits it and won’t open. I’ve adjusted and removed all the spacers and it still does it. Besides that, it’s a good everyday reel.
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: Had an issue out of the box
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these that have been flawless and are awesome reels. However this one upon removing the spool to have it filled, the retaining clip for the drag washer stack popped out. I re-inserted it, took the spool down to get filled. During the spooling process it came out again. I spread it out a bit to put more tension on it, took it home and used it the next day. The clip came out again during use causing bad scraping noise when the drag was used. I returned it. I had to purchase another locally as I needed it the next day also.
customer_reviews.author: QUITARZAN

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: Already have a variety of PENN reels in my kit. This time purchased the 3000 series. As ususal, not dissapointed and very happy with my purchase. Flawless functionality and construction. Stay safe folks...
customer_reviews.author: Wert

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Drag didn't work & the return window had closed before I used it.
customer_reviews.author: Harry W. Hawes

customer_reviews.title: NEVER buy blind on the internet
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an open face surf fishing reel. Something that could handle a 25lb stingray. I got this. Well, I think I'd strip the gears out of it before everything is said and done. It's smooth, and I'm sure durable since it's a Penn reel, but NOT being able to see it in person, touch it, match it up to what you need, you get burned....or at least I do. That's one of the reasons I don't buy clothes on the internet....
customer_reviews.author: Allan Wood

customer_reviews.title: Great Reel for the Money, One Minor Complaint
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the 5000 size. Overall I’m happy with the reel. The fit and finish is tight/clean. Drag is strong. Casts well. I’ve mostly been fishing bottom rigs on the surf w 2/3/4 oz weights on a 9’ heavy rod. My one complaint about the reel is that the handle can come loose by reeling backwards. In my opinion, there ought to be a screw that threads into the handle from the other side of the reel.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Homesley

customer_reviews.title: Penn Quality
customer_reviews.text: Switching from freshwater fishing to saltwater fishing and these Penn reels are a must have! They have SEALED ball bearings, not SHIELDED ball bearings. A biggggggg difference!!! Should last me my lifetime if taken care of!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big, Strong, good capacity...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for jetty sea fishing - casts well, holds a lot of line, and has a good drag. I pulled mine apart and lubed the drag discs - performed well and handled 25# fish without issue. Nice reel - Penn quality.
customer_reviews.author: T. B.

customer_reviews.title: You won’t be dissatisfied
customer_reviews.text: I own 3 Battle 2’s because they’re worth it. They’re made to last, you feel the quality I’m your hands the second you pick it up. I don’t believe in “all around fishing” reels, but a 3000 is close.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: I would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Nice reel. Would definitely buy again. I used it this summer for pan fishing and it's doing a good job. I paired it up with an Ugly Stick rod and it makes a winning combo. product_meta.title: Penn 1338216 Battle II 2000 Spinning Fishing Reel
product_meta.description: Arm yourself for the most punishing saltwater battles with the Penn Battle II Spinning Fishing Reel. Crafted from durable materials and packed with fish fighting features, this saltwater reel is engineered to catch fish year after year. From the full metal body, sideplate, and rotor to the five sealed stainless steel ball bearings, each component is designed to help you land your catch. The reel's HT 100 Versa Drag carbon fiber drag system leverages both sides of each drag washer to provide maximum drag, and its instant anti reverse bearing eliminates pullback so you reel without interruption. Additionally, the drag washers are treated with a proprietary grease to ensure long lasting performance. Suitable for use with Berkley or Spiderwire Superline, the spool is fitted with a rubber gasket that prevents the Superline from slipping under pressure meaning anglers can use braided line without a monofilament backing. And thanks to its line capacity rings, the spool displays at a glance how much line is remaining.
feature_bullets: Durable, high range spinning reel ideal for conquering big saltwater gamefish
Full metal body, sideplate, and rotor and heavy duty aluminum bail wire offer exceptional durability
HT 100 carbon fiber drag system provides powerful drag without sacrificing smoothness
Fluid cranking with 5 sealed stainless steel ball bearings and instant anti reverse bearing
Superline spool requires no backing, is braid ready, and has line capacity rings marked at 1/3, 2/3, and full capacity
